meanings.definition: Willing to consider or accept new suggestions or ideas.
meanings.sent1: She was very receptive to trying out different activities with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was receptive to feedback from all members.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed receptive to the idea of wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, always receptive to new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The garden soil was so receptive to water that the plants thrived.

meanings.definition: Able or willing to receive something, especially signals or stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The radio was receptive to various frequencies without any interference.
meanings.sent2: The satellite dish needed to be receptive to signals from outer space.
meanings.sent3: The robot was surprisingly receptive to commands from its owner.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a clear sky, always receptive to new ideas floating in.
meanings.sent5: The soil was so receptive to the seeds that they sprouted quickly.
